alert.note: Alert for Fayette; Lamar; Marion; Walker; Winston (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued February 22 at 5:20AM CST until further notice by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 3 PM CST THIS AFTERNOON THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of central Alabama, including the following counties, Fayette, Lamar, Marion, Walker and Winston. * WHEN...From 3 PM CST this afternoon through Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Rainfall on Monday was in the 1 to 2 inch range and has saturated the ground conditions. Another 1 to 3 inches of rain, with locally higher amounts, can be expected in a relatively short period of time during the watch. This may lead to flash flooding. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
